passage_text: The beef brisket should be roasted for roughly 1 hour per l lb (450 g) of meat. In this case, the brisket should cook for 3 to 4 hours. 1  Do not unwrap the brisket during the cooking process unless you are checking for doneness.

1 Cook and stir onions until they are tender but not brown. 2  Return brisket to the skillet. 3  Add one 28-ounce can crushed tomatoes, 1 cup lower-sodium beef broth, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, and 1 tablespoon crushed fines herbes. 1 Season the brisket with ground black pepper. 2  Pour the sauce over the brisket. 3  Cover the slow cooker and cook on the low-heat setting for 12 to 14 hours. 4  Or cook on the high-heat setting for 6 to 7 hours.

Return the brisket to the oven for 3 hours. Poke it with a fork to test whether it's ready; if the meat easily falls apart, it's done. If not, let it keep cooking until the meat is tender.
